title: Interactive Rose Day (Valentine Week) first-person bouquet builder finale

requirements.text: Create a single-page interactive Rose Day (Feb 7) experience that addresses the recipient in first-person using “you” language (do not refer to the recipient as “she”).

quotes: create a website for my girlfriend, its valentine week now and today is rose day 7th of feb.
use vocablary which includes "you" instead of she

acceptanceCriteria: All user-facing copy is in English and addresses the recipient as “you”.
No user-facing text refers to the recipient as “she/her”.
The experience works on both desktop and mobile browsers.

requirements.text: Implement an interactive flow that culminates in a ‘finale’ scene showing a digital bouquet of roses in a vase.

quotes: the conclusion should be a digital bouquete of roses

acceptanceCriteria: There is a clear final state/scene that presents a bouquet of roses placed in a vase.
The user can reach the finale by progressing through the interactive flow (not a static page only).

requirements.text: Build a 3D first-person perspective bouquet assembly scene using React Three Fiber (Three.js) where the user can add roses one-by-one and see them animate into the vase.

quotes: animate the bouquete in a way that when flowers are added they are aligned and are put in the vase
make it in first person perspective

acceptanceCriteria: The bouquet scene is rendered in 3D.
Camera behavior communicates first-person perspective (e.g., user looks from near eye-level toward the vase with look controls).
The user has an obvious interaction to add a flower (e.g., click/tap button or click the vase).
Each added rose animates from a spawn position into the vase (visible motion, not instantaneous placement).

requirements.text: Ensure bouquet construction logic aligns roses neatly: newly added roses should be positioned/rotated to form a visually coherent bouquet arrangement inside the vase (no random scattering outside the vase).

quotes: when flowers are added they are aligned and are put in the vase

acceptanceCriteria: Roses end their animation within the vase opening area (not clipping far outside).
Roses are arranged with consistent spacing and a believable bouquet silhouette (e.g., ring/spiral layering) as more are added.
Adding many roses (e.g., 20+) still results in an aligned arrangement without severe overlap artifacts.

requirements.text: Add a simple narrative/interactivity layer before and during bouquet building (e.g., short Rose Day prompts, a ‘start’ moment, and progression text) to make the website feel interactive rather than a single static 3D view.
acceptanceCriteria: There is an entry state (landing) and at least one intermediate interaction state before the finale bouquet completion moment.
Progression is clearly communicated (e.g., step indicator, ‘keep adding roses’, or a completion trigger).
All narrative text uses “you” phrasing.

requirements.text: Add a coherent visual theme for the entire site (colors, typography, spacing, UI styling) appropriate for Rose Day/Valentine Week, and apply it consistently across screens and UI components (avoid default template look).

quotes: create a website for my girlfriend, its valentine week now

acceptanceCriteria: A distinct, consistent theme is applied (background, type scale, buttons, cards, and 3D overlay UI).
Theme does not rely on a blue/purple palette as the primary identity colors.
UI remains readable with sufficient contrast.

requirements.text: Create required custom static images and use them in the UI (served from frontend/public/assets/generated, not through the backend).
acceptanceCriteria: Generated images exist in frontend/public/assets/generated with the exact filenames specified in imageRequirements.required.
At least one generated image is visibly used in the UI (e.g., background, header, or decorative panel).
No backend endpoints are used to fetch these images.

constraints: Do not edit files under frontend/src/components/ui (compose these components instead).
Do not edit frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts or frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts (use them only if needed).
Backend must remain a single Motoko actor; only add backend functionality if required by the requested UX.
nonGoals: User accounts, profiles, or persistence across devices.
External API integrations (social media, maps, messaging, LLMs).

required: Romantic Rose Day background illustration with subtle paper texture and scattered rose petals (rose-day-bg.dim_1920x1080.png)
Minimal elegant rose icon mark, flat vector style, transparent background (rose-mark.dim_512x512.png)
